trans-unit.source: Step 2: Expose a Relay Endpoint to Invoke Operations on ORDERS05 IDOC
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Expose a Relay Endpoint to Invoke Operations on ORDERS05 IDOC

trans-unit.source: There are two main steps required to expose an SAP artifact as an operation that can be invoked by sending a message over <token>sb2</token> – create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: There are two main steps required to expose an SAP artifact as an operation that can be invoked by sending a message over <token>sb2</token> – create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobtarget</token> defines how an <token>azure_2</token> application communicates to the Line-of-Business (LOB) system.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobtarget</token> defines how an <token>azure_2</token> application communicates to the Line-of-Business (LOB) system.

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> controls the LOB system connection URI, the operation to perform, and the connection credentials.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> controls the LOB system connection URI, the operation to perform, and the connection credentials.

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobrelay</token> is a WCF service running within an organizations firewall and listens to a relay endpoint on the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobrelay</token> is a WCF service running within an organizations firewall and listens to a relay endpoint on the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: As the name suggests, the <token>lobrelay</token> acts as a relay between the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and the LOB system.
trans-unit.target: As the name suggests, the <token>lobrelay</token> acts as a relay between the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and the LOB system.

trans-unit.source: It receives the message at the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and passes it on to the relevant LOB system using the <token>lobtarget</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: It receives the message at the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and passes it on to the relevant LOB system using the <token>lobtarget</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>BizTalk Adapter Service Architecture</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=241590</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>BizTalk Adapter Service Architecture</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=241590</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: In this topic, we create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token> to expose the <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel> operation on the ORDERS05 IDOC.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, we create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token> to expose the <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel> operation on the ORDERS05 IDOC.

trans-unit.source: To create an LOB Target and LOB Relay
trans-unit.target: To create an LOB Target and LOB Relay

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio (as an administrator), create a new <embeddedLabel><token>msgflow_proj</token></embeddedLabel>, and name it <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio (as an administrator), create a new <embeddedLabel><token>msgflow_proj</token></embeddedLabel>, and name it <embeddedLabel>SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You first start with adding a <token>lobconnect</token> server.
trans-unit.target: You first start with adding a <token>lobconnect</token> server.

trans-unit.source: This is the server where you installed the Runtime component of <token>lobconnect</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the server where you installed the Runtime component of <token>lobconnect</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add a <token>lobconnect</token> server, from the Server Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>s, and select <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To add a <token>lobconnect</token> server, from the Server Explorer in Visual Studio, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>s, and select <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel> dialog box, enter the URL of the WCF service that monitors that <token>sb2</token> relay service, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add <token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel> dialog box, enter the URL of the WCF service that monitors that <token>sb2</token> relay service, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: Because you have all the components of <token>lobconnect</token> installed on the same computer, the URL for that service will be <codeInline>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Because you have all the components of <token>lobconnect</token> installed on the same computer, the URL for that service will be <codeInline>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If you had installed <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime component on a separate computer, you replace ‘localhost’ in the above URL with the name of that computer.
trans-unit.target: If you had installed <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime component on a separate computer, you replace ‘localhost’ in the above URL with the name of that computer.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we are creating an application to integrate with SAP, so we must add an SAP target.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we are creating an application to integrate with SAP, so we must add an SAP target.

trans-unit.source: Expand the newly added server, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SAP</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SAP Target</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: Expand the newly added server, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SAP</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SAP Target</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard starts.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard starts.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to create an <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to create an <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: Read the information on the <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel> page, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Read the information on the <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel> page, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel> page, specify the details for the SAP Server to connect to and the credentials to use for the connection.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel> page, specify the details for the SAP Server to connect to and the credentials to use for the connection.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> page, expand the <embeddedLabel>ORDERSO5</embeddedLabel> IDOC category (under \IDOC\ORDERS\).
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> page, expand the <embeddedLabel>ORDERSO5</embeddedLabel> IDOC category (under \IDOC\ORDERS\).

trans-unit.source: There are several versions of the IDOC available.
trans-unit.target: There are several versions of the IDOC available.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, we’ll select <embeddedLabel>ORDERS05.V3(700)</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, we’ll select <embeddedLabel>ORDERS05.V3(700)</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Expand this IDOC, select <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel>, and then select the right arrow to add it to the <embeddedLabel>Selected Operations</embeddedLabel> box:
trans-unit.target: Expand this IDOC, select <embeddedLabel>Send</embeddedLabel>, and then select the right arrow to add it to the <embeddedLabel>Selected Operations</embeddedLabel> box:

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> page, specify the security mechanism to be used by the LOB Server to authenticate the target resource when a message arrives from a client.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> page, specify the security mechanism to be used by the LOB Server to authenticate the target resource when a message arrives from a client.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Username</embeddedLabel> and specify the credentials to connect to the SAP server.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Username</embeddedLabel> and specify the credentials to connect to the SAP server.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel> page, you create an <token>lobrelay</token> and an <token>lobtarget</token> to provide connectivity to your on-premise LOB applications from the cloud.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel> page, you create an <token>lobrelay</token> and an <token>lobtarget</token> to provide connectivity to your on-premise LOB applications from the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Create new</embeddedLabel> option to create a new relay and provide the following values:
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Create new</embeddedLabel> option to create a new relay and provide the following values:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace on which the LOB relay endpoint is created.
trans-unit.target: Specify the <token>sb2</token> namespace on which the LOB relay endpoint is created.

trans-unit.source: Issuer name
trans-unit.target: Issuer name

trans-unit.source: Specify the issuer name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: Specify the issuer name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: Issuer secret
trans-unit.target: Issuer secret

trans-unit.source: Specify the issuer secret for the <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: Specify the issuer secret for the <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: Relay path
trans-unit.target: Relay path

trans-unit.source: Specify a name for the relay.
trans-unit.target: Specify a name for the relay.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>sapintegration01</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>sapintegration01</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Target sub-path
trans-unit.target: Target sub-path

trans-unit.source: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.
trans-unit.target: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>orders</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>orders</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Target runtime URL</embeddedLabel> read-only property displays the URL where the relay is deployed on <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Target runtime URL</embeddedLabel> read-only property displays the URL where the relay is deployed on <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This is the path where you could send a message to be inserted into the on-premises SAP Server.
trans-unit.target: This is the path where you could send a message to be inserted into the on-premises SAP Server.

trans-unit.source: In our scenario, this is where the <token>bridge</token> sends the message.
trans-unit.target: In our scenario, this is where the <token>bridge</token> sends the message.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, review the values you specified in the previous steps, and then select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, review the values you specified in the previous steps, and then select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When the wizard completes, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: When the wizard completes, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio Server Explorer, you now have an entry under the <embeddedLabel>SAP</embeddedLabel> node.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio Server Explorer, you now have an entry under the <embeddedLabel>SAP</embeddedLabel> node.

trans-unit.source: This represents the relay endpoint created in <token>sb2</token> to relay PO messages coming from the cloud to the on-premises SAP system.
trans-unit.target: This represents the relay endpoint created in <token>sb2</token> to relay PO messages coming from the cloud to the on-premises SAP system.

trans-unit.source: To add schemas
trans-unit.target: To add schemas

trans-unit.source: After adding the relay endpoint to an SAP system, you must add schemas that to send ORDERS05 PO messages to the SAP server.
trans-unit.target: After adding the relay endpoint to an SAP system, you must add schemas that to send ORDERS05 PO messages to the SAP server.

trans-unit.source: To add the schemas, right-click the relay endpoint and select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas to SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To add the schemas, right-click the relay endpoint and select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas to SAPIntegration</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Enter a filename prefix that will be included in the name of each schema file that is generated.
trans-unit.target: Enter a filename prefix that will be included in the name of each schema file that is generated.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify this as <userInput>SAPIntegration_</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify this as <userInput>SAPIntegration_</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a folder name that will be added to your solution under which all the schemas will be added.
trans-unit.target: Enter a folder name that will be added to your solution under which all the schemas will be added.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, specify the folder name as <userInput>LOB Schemas</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, specify the folder name as <userInput>LOB Schemas</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials to connect to an SAP system.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials to connect to an SAP system.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The schemas are added to the project under an <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel> folder.
trans-unit.target: The schemas are added to the project under an <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel> folder.

trans-unit.source: To use the LOB Target
trans-unit.target: To use the LOB Target

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.

trans-unit.source: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:
trans-unit.target: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Username</embeddedLabel>, and enter the username and password to connect to the SAP Server.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Username</embeddedLabel>, and enter the username and password to connect to the SAP Server.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.

trans-unit.source: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: If using the examples above, it is <legacyItalic>sapintegration01_orders</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: If using the examples above, it is <legacyItalic>sapintegration01_orders</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Open the .config file for the <token>lobtarget</token>, which typically has the naming convention as <legacyItalic>YourRelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: Open the .config file for the <token>lobtarget</token>, which typically has the naming convention as <legacyItalic>YourRelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Specify the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Specify the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the config file.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the config file.
